MediaKeySession.summary: The MediaKeySession interface of the Encrypted Media Extensions API represents a context for message exchange with a content decryption module (CDM).

MediaKeySessionClose.summary:
The close() method of the interface notifies that the current media session is no longer needed, and that the content decryption module should release any resources associated with this object and close it.
Then, it returns a .

MediaKeySessionClosed.summary:
The closed read-only property of the interface returns a {{jsxref('Promise')}} signaling when a closes.
This promise can only be fulfilled and is never rejected.
Closing a session means that licenses and keys associated with it are no longer valid for decrypting media data.

MediaKeySessionExpiration.summary: The expiration read-only property of the interface returns the time after which the keys in the current session can no longer be used to decrypt media data, or NaN if no such time exists.

remarks.para:
This value is determined by the CDM and measured in milliseconds since January 1, 1970, UTC.
This value may change during a session lifetime, such as when an action triggers the start of a window.

MediaKeySessionGenerateRequest.summary: The generateRequest() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref('Promise')}} after generating a license request based on initialization data.

MediaKeySessionKeyStatuses.summary: The keyStatuses read-only property of the interface returns a reference to a read-only of the current session's keys and their statuses.

MediaKeySessionKeystatuseschange.summary: The keystatuseschange event of the API fires when there has been a change in the keys or their statuses within a session.

MediaKeySessionLoad.summary: The load() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref('Promise')}} that resolves to a boolean value after loading data for a specified session object.
MediaKeySessionLoad.returns: A that resolves to a boolean indicating whether the load succeeded or failed.

MediaKeySessionMessage.summary:
The message event of the
interface fires when a message is generated by the
content decryption module.

MediaKeySessionRemove.summary: The remove() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref('Promise')}} after removing any session data associated with the current object.

MediaKeySessionSessionId.summary: The sessionId read-only property of the interface contains a unique string generated by the content decryption module (CDM) for the current media object and its associated keys or licenses.

MediaKeySessionUpdate.summary: The update() method of the interface loads messages and licenses to the CDM, and then returns a {{jsxref('Promise')}}.
